title: Project management tool for Emacs packages
description: I'm sharing my experience and observations about build tools for Emacs packages. While makem.sh is wonderfully simple and cask is a robust classic, I've found eldev's extensibility and native Emacs Lisp implementation particularly useful. The choice really depends on your needs - makem.sh is great for simpler projects, but when you need more customization, tools like eldev or cask become more attractive.
